conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful note and for your continued interest in School_C.

At this stage, our remaining seat is being managed strictly according to our priority order. We can’t share details about specific candidates’ status or whether particular individuals are actively in conversation with us. What we can share is our process: we would only move to the next student in line if higher-priority candidates are no longer available to match with School_C (e.g., they match elsewhere or are otherwise no longer pursuing us) or if the process reaches a point where it is clear they will not be applying.

If your status or commitment changes in any way, you’re welcome to keep us updated. We appreciate your patience and continued engagement.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for the careful question and for staying engaged.

In our process, we move to the next student in line only when, based on the information available to us in the market, higher-priority candidates are no longer realistically available to match with School_C. Practically, that is typically triggered by one of the following:

1) A higher-priority student matches elsewhere (so they exit the market), or
2) As rounds progress, it becomes clear they are not pursuing School_C (e.g., they consistently do not contact/apply to us while pursuing other options), and we reach a point where holding the seat further would be unlikely to change that.

We reassess this round-by-round, with increased urgency as we approach the later rounds, but we do not have a fixed public “cutoff round” at which we automatically move down the list.

We appreciate your continued interest. If you decide at any point to submit an [APPLY] again, we will review it immediately in line with our priority order at that time.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[TALK]

We should avoid committing to a specific round cutoff; instead state we move down only when higher-priority candidates are matched elsewhere or it becomes clear they will not apply (e.g., late rounds/no contact), and that we reassess each round and especially near the end.
